response:
In a 35-year-old man with subacute isolated unilateral optic neuropathy, demyelinating optic neuritis is most likely, but autoimmune, ischemic, compressive, toxic/nutritional, infectious, and retinal causes must be excluded, particularly NMOSD/MOGAD and ischemic optic neuropathy.

differential_diagnosis = ["Demyelinating optic neuritis (multiple-sclerosis\u2013associated or idiopathic)", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody-associated optic neuritis (MOGAD)", "Aquaporin-4 antibody-positive neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (NMOSD) presenting with optic neuritis", "Non-arteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION)", "Compressive optic neuropathy (e.g., optic nerve sheath meningioma, orbital mass, pituitary or chiasmal lesion)", "Sarcoid-related optic neuropathy", "Syphilitic optic neuritis or optic neuropathy", "Toxic or nutritional optic neuropathy (e.g., alcohol-related, medication-induced, vitamin B12 deficiency)", "Retinal vascular occlusion or severe macular disease causing monocular visual loss"]
